intro: Uragoga lasiopus, commonly known as the hairy uragoga, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
